alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 23 at 10:35AM CST until January 26 at 11:08PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Boling. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins upstream from the gage with significant backwater flooding up Peach Creek in Wharton County inundating low lying areas. Minor backwater flooding up Snake Creek in Fort Bend County begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 17.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 21.5 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.6 feet on 02/09/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri San Bernard River Boling 18.0 17.2 Tue 10 am CS 20.1 21.2 17.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM CST.
